meanings.definition: To take away the right to redeem (a mortgage) by foreclosure.
meanings.sent1: The bank will foreclose on the house if the mortgage is not paid on time.
meanings.sent2: If the homeowner fails to make payments, the bank may foreclose on the property.
meanings.sent3: I joked that the bank would foreclose on my imaginary castle if I didn't pay my pretend mortgage.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to foreclose any hope of saving the failing business.
meanings.sent5: The threat of foreclosure loomed large as the family struggled to make ends meet.
